New Records: South Korea maintained a perfect record after their first two games in the 2026 World Cup qualifiers.
Son Heung-Min became a key player with two goals and one assist in the match.
Key Match Events: Son Heung-Min scored an 11th-minute penalty after Hwang Hee-chan was fouled in the area.
Son Heung-Min added a second goal with a header from Lee Kang-in's corner.
Jung Seung-hyun headed in from a free kick three minutes before full time.
Post-Match Reflections: The win keeps South Korea perfect after the first two games in the second round of Asia's preliminaries for the 2026 World Cup.
China suffered their first defeat after winning against Thailand on Thursday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Korea's victory was part of a series of wins by other teams in the same round.
The match was played in Shenzhen, with Son Heung-Min leading the team to a commanding 3-0 win.
Others: The article also mentioned other matches in the same round, such as Japan's win over Syria and Australia's win over Palestine.
